definition: the act of discharging a gun, eliminate (a substance)
details:
noun
- the act of discharging a gun
= synonyms: firing, firing off
- a formal written statement of relinquishment
= synonyms: release
- the termination of someone's employment (leaving them free to depart)
= synonyms: liberation
- the act of venting
= synonyms: venting
- the sudden giving off of energy
- the pouring forth of a fluid
= synonyms: run, outpouring
- electrical conduction through a gas in an applied electric field
= synonyms: spark, arc, electric arc, electric discharge
- any of several bodily processes by which substances go out of the body
= example: any of several bodily processes by which substances go out of the body
= synonyms: emission, expelling
- a substance that is emitted or released
= synonyms: emission
verb
- eliminate (a substance)
= synonyms: release
- become empty or void of its content
= synonyms: empty
- pronounce not guilty of criminal charges
= synonyms: clear, acquit, assoil, exonerate, exculpate
- release from military service
= synonyms: muster out
- cause to go off
= synonyms: fire
- go off or discharge
= synonyms: fire, go off
- pour forth or release
= example: pour forth or release
- remove the charge from
- leave or unload
= synonyms: drop, drop off, put down, set down, unload
- free from obligations or duties
= synonyms: free
- complete or carry out
= example: complete or carry out
= synonyms: dispatch
